description:
Exorcist is a Pac-Man variant. The player takes control of Sparkie, a blobby yet spikey character who is lost in the haunted catacombs beneath the ruins of an old monastery. Ghosts and other nasty creatures wander around the corridors of the catacombs and now Sparkie has to find a way to escape.

Unlike Pac-Man, Exorcist doesn't feature any pills that has to be collected. Instead the idea here is to illuminate all of the walls of the mazes. This is done automatically as the player moves Sparkie through the corridors. When a maze is fully lit the ghosts will be exorcised and a number of exits will open up and the player can move on to other mazes. All mazes are connected to each other and the player can move back and forth between them. If Sparkie comes into contact with the ghosts he will have to restart the maze and he will lose some of his energy. When all energy is lost the game is over.

It is possible to shoot at the ghosts by picking up lightning that can be found in each maze. This causes the ghosts to slow down but it can only be used for a few second before it disappears. Energy can be replenished by shooting the exorcised ghosts.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lightning can be used to shoot at the ghosts.
Doors open up when level is completed and the ghosts flee

title: Exorcist

description:
"You are trapped on a supposedly dead moon and your only means of escape is to drive your small highly versatile surface buggy across the many treacherous sectors of the Auto Zone."

This is a horizontally scrolling platformer game, where the screen keeps scrolling automatically to the left as your vehicle (called the XL-Procon) is progressing forward. You have to guide the vehicle by making it jump over gaps and onto higher platforms to avoid collision with walls or fall into the water. There are two speeds you can travel with, so you can adjust your jumps to the appropriate situation. The game features 16 levels and colorful graphics comparable to Atari 8-bit standards.
title: Auto Zone

description:
You are a Bounty Hunter and in your XK155 Hover-Car you travel around the city of Xcellor8 looking for criminals called Runners. When you have found and shot a Runner you can then go to the bank to collect your money as your reward. The more Runners you catch the more money you make. At the bank you must try to get to a counter as quick as possible as the reward gets lower. You have to select a queue and you can keep changing queues to move to a faster one.

Any money you collect can now be spent at the shop to upgrade your car or purchase fuel. The longer you drive the more fuel you consume so you must keep an eye on your fuel gauge or it's game over. If you hit anything then your shield gauge will get smaller as well as your gun-charge when you use your gun. Be careful not to hit any innocent droids as they need to be taken to a hospital to repair if you have enough money. Hit three droids and it's game over.

Xcellor8 is a multi-scrolling game with the screen scrolling as you move viewed from above. You control the hover-car and your droid in the bank queue with a joystick. As well as the main playing area you can also see your money, innocents hit, Runners killed, your shield, gun-charge and fuel gauges. There is also a scanner showing where the Runners and Innocent droids are.
title: Xcellor8

description: Xargon Wars is a shoot-em-up in the style of the arcade game Astro Blaster where you are a gunnery commander and you must use your gun to defend your planet from wave after wave of alien invaders. There are 16 waves of aliens to blast and all aliens must be destroyed on each level to move to the next. Be careful not to over use your cannon as it can overheat and then you will have to wait for it to cool. A gauge on the right of the playing area shows your gun temperature. You can select from one to four lives and it is game over when all are lost.
title: Xargon Wars

description: Wimbledon is a tennis game that allows you to play a friend or the computer for one match. Before you play the match there are various options you can select which are difficulty (1-4), how many sets (1-3) and speed of the match (1-4). The actual match is viewed from above with the whole court shown on the screen. The player serving presses the fire button and the serve is played automatically. The player returning the ball can move around the court and when they want to hit the ball they hold down the fire button (the longer held the harder the shot) and when it is let go this hits the ball. The direction the ball goes is the position of the player when they hit the ball. All the normal rules and scoring for tennis are used.
title: Wimbledon

description:
Voidrunner + Hellgate is a collection of two games programmed by Jeff Minter:

  • Voidrunner
  • Hellgate

The games are not available separately on the Commodore 16/Plus 4.
title: Voidrunner + Hellgate

description:
Your Grandaddy has died and in his will he has left you 16 goldmines still full of gold to make you rich beyond your wildest dreams. Problem is before he died he made sure it was also full of traps and creatures due to the lack of you visiting him over the years. So off you go to risk life and limb to become a rich man.

Varmit is a flick-screen platform game where you must explore each mine one at a time to collect ten bits of gold to clear the mine. Each mine is made up of three levels with ladders connecting certain levels, so you have to go back to previous screens to get the gold. There are also bonus items to collect for extra points. There are many hazards like bats, carts and falling rocks, and if any touch you then it's back to the entrance of the mine with the loss of one of your four lives. You keep everything collected though.

Later levels have walls blocking routes and even fake gold. You need to collect the gold as quick as possible as a river flows underneath the mine and after a short time it slowly rises flooding the mine. A joystick or keyboard can be used to control your miner.

sample_screenshots.caption: Get the spade for bonus points.

title: Varmit

description: Tutti Frutti is based on the arcade game Mr. Do! where you play Super Strawberry, The King of the Orchard who must collect all the ripe cherries. Trying to stop you are the Acid Apple Gang who wander around the orchard and one touch from them loses one of five lives but you can fire at them to kill them. Walking through the dirt creates a path which the Gang can walk on but they can't walk through the dirt themselves. Be careful walking under apples as well as you have a very short time before it falls on top of you. Collect all the cherries on the level and you move to the next one. The whole level is shown on one screen and as well as the main playing area you can also see your score, time, Bonus, lives, level and a high score table.
title: Tutti Frutti

description:
You are Kalok and you fought so hard and so brave but in the end the evil warlock, Xorphas finally defeated you and killed you. Problem is instead of your soul going to warrior heaven, Xorphas has sought revenge by stealing your heart which means your soul is destined to wander for ever in Limbo. You still have the Sword of Destiny so you decide that you will descend into the depths of the Warlock's lair, The Abyss of Death and get your heart back. You must fight off evil nasties as well as find flashing objects which open up more of the Abyss. Scattered around are small volcano type mounds and when you jump on them they allow you to jump up higher. Touch any nasty or fall from a height then your Astral power bar will decrease slightly. When it is empty it is game over.

Sword of Destiny is a one player flick-screen platform game. You use a joystick or the keyboard to control your hero.

sample_screenshots.caption: Those mounds allow you to jump higher.

title: Sword of Destiny

description:
Street Olympics is a one player game that allows you to participate in four different events trying to beat the records. There are two running events, one running and jumping, and a throwing event and you can play them all one after the other or practise each one.

The first two running events are 200m sprint and 800m jogging. You waggle the joystick (or keyboard keys) left and right as fast as you can. There is a distance bar that lets you know how far left to run. There is a beep and the clock stops when you have completed the run but you have to stop waggling to stop or you will just keep running.

The running and jumping event has you waggling the joystick to run but when a obstacle appears then you press the fire button to jump. The throwing event has you running waggling the joystick and when you reach the line you hold the fire button down and a angle chart appears. Let go of the fire button at the best angle and you throw the object.

Each event is viewed from the side as your athlete moves from left to right with the screen scrolling as you move.
title: Street Olympics

description:
You are here in your Corastron Ship to save the galaxy after scientists on the planet Sistasis blew up the planet trying to discover what made the planets core active and now dangerous Plastron Boulders are loose. The game is split into three stages with each stage played on one screen as you try to control the boulders.

Stage One: There are three coloured boulders bouncing around the screen and the yellow and purple boulders must be directed into their home slots while the grey boulder will disrupt the stage but is needed when the coloured boulders are in their slots. You must move around the screen and shoot the two coloured home slots until they turn lighter and finally start flashing. When the yellow home slot is flashing your ship turns into a bat. You must now direct the two coloured boulders into the slots at a clean 45 degree angle. If a boulder is in it's slot and the grey boulder touches it then the boulder starts bouncing around the screen again. Once both coloured boulders are home then you must direct the grey boulder into all four corners. The coloured boulders can still be knocked out of their slots. Your energy gauge is just the yellow and purple bars and you lose energy when you touch any boulder. Once both gauges are empty then it is game over.

Stage Two: You now have four different coloured boulders bouncing around and the aim is to keep shooting the force field bit by bit until it disappears from the top or bottom of the screen. You can move around the whole screen but can't hit the force field from the sides. While shooting you must avoid touching any boulder as this will lose part of your energy bar. You now have four parts of your energy gauge and once again it's game over when it is empty. The more of the force field you destroy the more boulders that enter the screen.

Stage Three: The final stage will see you trying to round up six different coloured boulders by shooting each boulder in the correct sequence. When the correct boulder is weakened by your constant shooting it jumps up the line to the next boulder. Keep doing this until you weaken the last coloured boulder. There are other coloured boulders but don't react to your shooting and is just wasting time shooting them. A red boulder will bounce around the screen and if you touch it then the line of boulders reset and you have to start again. You have a full gauge and touching boulders decreases it and it is game over when it is empty.

Between each stage is a bonus round to build up your score. Pick up pods to make yourself bigger and when happy with your size (this dictates the amount of boulders as well) you can move into the playing screen and try to deflect boulders into your character to score points. When your energy gauges are empty you move on to the next stage. A joystick is used to control your ship.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to direct the balls into their home slot.
Got a ball in it's slot.

title: Starburst: A Walk on the Wild Side

description:
Sports 4 is a compilation of four sports games:

Thai Boxing: A beat-em-up viewed from the side where you must fight one opponent with various moves with the choice of three skill levels.

Canoe Slalom: Viewed from the side at an elevated angle, you must control a canoe through a course in the fastest time with three skill levels. If you miss a gate then you receive a fault and miss four and the game is over.

European Cup Championship: A soccer game for one or two players with the game viewed from the side at an elevated angle. The rules of soccer apply and the winner is the player with the most goals.

Speed Boat Grand Prix: In a 3rd person perspective, you control a speedboat and must complete three courses (each one more difficult) in the fastest time. Miss a gate and you receive a penalty point, and receive ten points and you lose one of three boats.

Thai Boxing was also released on its own while the other three games were only released as part of compilations.
title: Sports 4

description: You are a maintenance robot who works in a video shop located in a castle. It is your job to switch off the all the videos that have been left on by His Lordship. The game is a flick-screen maze game where you must explore each screen for a video machine to switch off. There are Meanies wandering the maze and will try to kill you. Touch one and you lose one of six lives. There are also walls that need to destroying to make a path as well as certain parts of a screen require a key to enter. As well as the main playing area you can see your score, lives and a jigsaw puzzle and you get pieces for it for every video turned off. Complete the jigsaw and you have completed the game.
title: Video Meanies

description: The seas of the world are now full of man eating sharks and it's up to you to dive in the seas and kill them all with your harpoon gun. Over various levels you must shoot a shark to move on to the next level. The game is viewed from the side with the whole level shown on the screen. The shark swims at the top of the screen while you can only move left and right on the bottom. You must fire a harpoon upwards to kill him. As you play a level, your air gauge decreases and if you don't kill the shark by the time it reaches zero then you lose one of three lives. As the levels progress then there are other sea creatures to be aware of like eels, fish and squid. These have to be avoided and can't be shot and when touched then you lose a life.
title: Shark

description: Runner is a single screen platform game with various levels, where you control a spaceman with a jet-pac who must traverse over platforms and up ladders to reach the top of each screen and collect three keys. Once all three keys are collected you move to the next level. On each level there are nasties that roam around each screen and you will lose one of four lives when a nasty is touched but you can use your jet-pac to fly over them and it can also help you jump gaps. When the jet-pac is being used its fuel decreases but the fuel increases when not in use. Falling from a certain height will also lose a life and when all are gone it's game over.
title: Runner

description:
Deep underground on the planet Zylon, 28 geologists are trapped and with the water levels rising quickly, you have been tasked to fly your airship into the caverns and rescue them all. The game is flick-screen with each cavern shown on the whole screen viewed from the side with a passage connecting other caverns. You control the airship with your joystick and when you move the airship it keeps moving until you move the joystick in the opposite direction to slow it down and even stop.

Hitting any part of the cavern and walls gives you a damage point and when you collect ten then it is game over but rescue a geologist and it is reduced. As you explore and fly through the caverns there is a clock counting down showing the water level and as the clock gets lower, caverns will flood killing the men. If you touch the water then it is game over. Once you collect all 28 geologists and return to the surface you then attempt the next level which is the same layout but now introduces acid droplets which increase your damage. There are eight levels in total and each one introduces more acid and makes them fall faster.

As well as the main playing area you can also see your score, damage, ship-depth, hi-score, bonus for geologists rescued and the water depth. Before you play the game you can select which level to play and the control sensitivity of the airship.
title: Rescue From Zylon

description:
Prospector Pete is a game heavily influenced by the game O'Riley's Mine where you control Prospector Pete over 16 mines trying to collect gold, as well as gas and oil. The game is viewed from the side with the majority of the level shown on the screen with the screen scrolling to the left or right. You must collect all the gold on each level before a ladder appears at the top of the screen to exit the mine.

As you start tunneling around the level, a stick of dynamite will blow and rising water will fill a tunnel and flow around all tunnels you have made, touch the water and you lose one of three lives. Also meanies will roam the tunnels and you lose a life as well if touched. To help you against the meanies you have a limited number of dynamite which can be dropped to stop them.
title: Prospector Pete

description:
Project Nova is a 1st person shooter where you are the pilot of a space craft and you must explore various sectors to find alien ships and destroy them. Before you play the game you can select which level you want to start on (1-8). You start the game looking out into empty space inside the cockpit of your craft with the option to look out from the rear. On your instrument panel which is shown on the top and bottom of the screen is your energy status, speed, your rating, shield status, view and how many hostiles in the area. Pressing 0-9 on the keyboard controls your speed but uses up energy so must be used carefully. Pressing F1, F2 or F3 activates your shield from Green (No Shield), Amber (20% capacity) and Red (Full) which also requires the use of energy.

Pressing C brings up your ships computer which gives a status report on various parts of your craft and a map of the area containing all the sectors. Each sector contains a number telling you how many hostiles are in that area and also which ones contain energy to top up your energy supply. These sectors can still contain alien ships. You move a cursor onto the sector you require to explore and press H for hyperspace. Once you are in the sector you use the joystick to control your craft to move a laser sight and pressing fire to fire a laser. You are also able to repair your ship if you receive damage but receive to much and it is game over.
title: Project Nova

description: Powerball is a platform game where you control a ball and collect chalices over eight levels as the screen scrolls from left to right when you move. Your ball will bounce to the left or the right when you move the joystick and pressing fire will allow it to bounce higher. You lose one of four lives if you hit anything sharp or fall to the bottom of the screen. If you do lose your lives you can start the game again from where you last died or start at the beginning of the level.
title: Powerball

description: Pin Point is based on the game Spindizzy where you control a spinning top over ten flick-screen isometric levels to reach a white flag. Each level is a route of platforms and you must guide the top without falling of the edges within a time limit. If you fall of the edge then you start at the beginning of the level wasting valuable time. You must be aware of the inertia of the top as it will keep moving after moving downhill so the joystick will need pressing in the opposite direction. To get up some hills or clear gaps you can give a little burst of speed by pressing the fire button.

sample_screenshots.caption: There's the white flag but a long way to go.

title: Pin Point

description:
You are on a strange alien world trapped in a network of caverns which are connected by energy curtains and they can only be opened by making sure all plants in the cavern are fully grown. Viewed from the side as the screen scrolls left and right when you move, Petals of Doom has you having to blast the creatures that dwell in the caverns, making sure they don't stamp on the plants. Before you play the game you decide how many lives you require from one to six.

As you protect each plant, they will grow over time, and when all have grown you can move to the next cavern but will shrink when touched by an alien. The growth of the plants is indicated by a bar and when it empties then the plants have fully grown. Another bar to watch is your power bar and this decreases if you touch an alien, fire your laser or fly your jet-pack and when empty you lose a life but will increase if you aren't touched or don't use your laser or jet-pack. When tall enough, the plants can be stood behind and the aliens can't touch you. A radar at the top of the screen shows the location of any aliens and the keyboard or joystick is used to control your hero.
title: Petals of Doom

description: With your BMX you have entered the Mastertronic Gold Cup which has you attempting to complete five different courses to become the champion. The game is viewed from above with the screen scrolling upwards continuously and you use the joystick or keyboard to control your bike. You must keep your bike on the path avoiding any obstacles and if you crash then you lose one of three lives. Along the way are flags and they must all be collected or the game is over when you reach the end of a course. You also have an energy bar which decreases as you ride but energy pods can be collected to increase the bar.
title: BMX Racers

description:
Oblido is an arcade puzzle game where you have to move four sets of nine counters made up of different colours and patterns into the same coloured reception area over various levels. The game is viewed from above with the whole level shown on the screen as a maze and each level has to be completed within a time limit using a cursor. The maze is made up of two areas which are coloured blue and grey and you can move anywhere through blue areas but are unable to enter grey areas so you must use the pathways to move to different parts of the level.

The counters are scattered all over each level and can only be pushed through blue areas but you are able to push as many counters as you like in a line. As you are pushing counters, sinners move about the pathways from a sin bin and if you touch one then you lose time and it is game over when the time runs out. You have the ability to fire at the sinners to kill them but they can also fire back if you are anywhere on the level which loses more time when shot.

sample_screenshots.caption: A red counter now in place.

title: Oblido

description: In a land of dinosaurs and hardships, humans have to be tough to survive but unfortunately a new breed of human has started appearing 'The Wimp'. Unable to hunt, these men need a special vitamin to keep them alive but these are in dangerous places with many hazards. You play one wimp, Mr. Puniverse as you attempt to collect vitamins in this flick-screen platform game. One or two players take it in turns after a loss of life trying not to let your energy bar decrease fully or you lose one of eight lives and you lose a life if you fall from a height. There are objects that fire at you and pillars that move up and down, and if these are touched then a life is also lost.
title: Mr. Puniverse

description:
Your task is to destroy all Megabolts who have invaded your world over 64 screens on a 8x8 grid connected by various passages. The game is a maze game viewed from above with each maze shown on the whole screen and you must control a craft killing all the Megabolt's ships that move about the maze. To kill them you can either shoot them with your laser or you can crush them with part of a wall which you fire at to move. There is also a spinning yellow craft that moves about the maze and this can't be shot just avoided. Touch this spinning craft or a Megabolt and you lose one of six lives.

As you move about the maze you have a fuel gauge which is slowly decreasing and when this runs out you lose a live but you can collect moving orange diamonds to increase it. As well as the main playing area you can also see your score, lives, high score, how many Megabolts to destroy in that maze, your grid location and an alert which tells you which grids still have Megabolts active.
title: Megabolts

description:
A once prosperous land inhabited by an evil wizard has stayed uninhabited long after he left. There are tales though that he left behind in his lair a golden statue which is priceless. You play as an adventurer who has entered the land looking for the buried treasure. The game is a flick-screen arcade adventure viewed from the side with elements of a platform game. There are eight skill levels to choose from and when the game is completed you start again on a higher skill level.

As you explore you will encounter buildings to explore as well as creatures and objects that will harm you. As you move about, you have a strength gauge which is slowly decreasing but you can find potions and food to keep it topped up. Touching creatures like bats or items like falling apples and water will decrease the gauge further and be wary of certain potions that are poison and an antidote needs to be found before you die and it's game over.

To succeed in your quest, certain items need to be found before you can get to the statue which are seven talismans scattered all over the surrounding area, two keys to unlock doors to enter buildings, and a candle to see in the underground section. A joystick or keyboard can be used to control your hero.
title: The Magicians Curse

description: Legionnaire is a run 'n gun game based on the arcade game Commando where your mission is to get to Garrison Headquarters over seven different landscapes to deliver vital messages. The game is viewed from a 3rd person perspective at an elevated angle with the screen scrolling upwards when you move. As you progress up the screen various soldiers will appear and you must avoid or shoot them with your gun because if you touch one or are shot then you lose one of five lives. To hinder you there are various obstacles that need avoiding like walls, trees and water.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oops. I got hit and was killed.

title: Legionnaire

description: Reach for the Sky is a shoot 'em up in the vain of Capcom's arcade classic 1942. You fly over the Pacific Ocean during the WWII and take down waves of enemy planes while avoiding their counter-fire. Weapon upgrades are earned if specific formations of enemy waves (different to each level) are taken down with no escaping planes. At the end of each level you have to battle with a giant bomber.
title: Reach for the Sky

description: You have upset and failed to impress Emperor To-Ming, and so he has sent you all the way down to the eighth skill level, the ultimate humiliation. To progress back up the skill levels you must defeat a certain amount of minion's before facing a Guardian Lizard and defeating it to move to the next level. The game is viewed from the side and as you walk left or right, waves of minions come running at you from either edge of the screen. You can kick or punch them and they disappear with one hit. As you defeat the minions, an enemy bar increases and when full, the levels Guardian Lizard appears. If you are touched or hit at any time, then an energy bar decreases and when this empties then you lose one of four lives and the enemy bar goes back to empty.
title: Kung-Fu Kid

description: Jail Break is a game based on the Arcade game Breakout where you control a bat at the bottom of the screen and you deflect a ball upwards to hit and remove bricks. Once all bricks have been removed you then move onto the next level. If the ball passes the bat and hits the bottom of the screen you lose one of five lives. You can have a practise before playing the main game which allows you to have an unlimited supply of lives. The keyboard or a joystick is used to control your bat.
title: Jail Break

description: Your aim in this single screen platform game spread over 15 levels is to collect all the money that was stolen in various bank raids. You must navigate the various platforms attempting to collect all the keys to the safe before finding the exit. There are various creatures roaming around the screen as well who don't want their money taken and if you touch one then you lose one of seven lives and the screen you're on has to be started again. To move up and down platforms there are poles that you can only use in the direction it is moving and there are also lifts to move to other parts of the screen. Once you have opened the safe and collected the money, before exiting you must make sure all the platforms have been changed from black to white.
title: The Exploits of Fingers Malone

description: Zagan Warrior is a 1st person perspective shooter where you are an elite Zagan Warrior and you must ride your Zagan Chaser around the Crystal Forest on the planet Sirus 3 blasting Tycons. You are able to steer left or right, and accelerate or decelerate your chaser as you look for Tycons riding around. As soon as you are sitting on the chaser then your energy decreases and you must destroy a certain amount of Tycons to move to the next level. To fire your weapon you must be travelling at full speed but you must look out for poles moving towards you. As you fire at the Tycons, they will fire back and if you are hit by their weapon, hit a pole or run out of energy then you lose one of three lives. Occasionally a Mothership will appear and destroying this gives you bonus points.
title: Zagan Warrior

description: Zap-Em is a shooter where you sit at the bottom of the screen moving left or right and blasting aliens moving down the screen in unpredictable patterns, firing back at you. You are also able to thrust forward briefly to avoid aliens moving on the bottom of the screen. The game is a couple of screen lengths wide so a ship location is on the top of the screen showing your position. The longer you play then different attack waves appear and if you touch an alien or get hit by it's bullets then you lose one of three lives.
title: Zap-Em

description:
ZIP is a collection of three games that contains:

Transector: Your planet is dangerously low on the metal C-2056 and so in this top view single screen game you have to move about the screen collecting the metal while avoiding the guards and their weapons over various levels. If you touch a guard or its weapon then you lose one of five lives.

Destructor: Your mission in this side view single screen game is to protect Earth from a Metanoid Ship in your MKII Destructor Ship. You sit on the bottom of the screen moving left or right, and you must hit the Metanoid Ship ten times to destroy it but the Metanoid drops bombs as it moves left to right and back again on the top of the screen. You must keep moving because if you stay still for too long then you will be destroyed and if you are destroyed or hit by a bomb then you lose one of five lives. Once the ship is destroyed then another one appears but lower down the screen.

Asteroid Belt: In this side view single screen game, your spacecraft sits on the top of the screen in an asteroid field. You must move left or right as various size asteroids move up the screen and must be avoided. If you touch an asteroid then you lose one of three lives but you do have three shields which protect you when activated for a short time.
title: ZIP

description: Zone Control is a top view single screen shooter where you must move around the screen collecting gems to sell to the Galactic Federation. The gems appear occasionally on the screen and protecting them are endless waves of defence squads which fire at you. If you touch a Defence Squad or get hit by its bullets then you lose one of nine lives. Shooting a certain amount of Defence Squads gives you bonus points.
title: Zone Control

description: Xadium has you controlling a spacecraft over the surface of a planet and underground through a network of tunnels. The first part has you viewing your craft from a 3rd person perspective and you must move left or right through gates that come towards you. You also have the ability to accelerate and brake and the gates must be completed before a clock runs out. If you hit or miss a gate then the clock decreases. The second part sees you view your craft from the side as you move through a network of tunnels looking for the exit before the clock runs out. You also have the ability to shoot any obstacles in your way.
title: Xadium

description: Your people have won the war against Xargon and now in one last attack you have been tasked to destroy their planet and their four satellite planets in your spacecraft. Problem is, the Xargon's have been warned you are coming and so have sent all their Warriors to defend the planets against your attack. Xargon's Revenge is a shooter viewed from the side on a single screen for each planet. You sit on the left on the screen blasting the Warriors who move from right to left in unpredictable patterns and if you touch one then you lose one of five lives. Every Warrior must be destroyed on each screen to progress to the next but it has to be done before your fuel gauge runs out. Fuel capsules though occasionally bounce towards you and if collected increase your fuel as running out of fuel loses a life.
title: Xargon's Revenge

description: Water Grand Prix is a driving game viewed from a 3rd person perspective where you must drive a speedboat along a river, passing other boats for as long as possible with a miles counter indicating how far you have travelled. As well as steering left or right, you can accelerate and decelerate and also change gears (High or Low). If you touch a boat or the sides of the river, then you lose one of three lives.
title: Water Grand Prix

description: Winnie the Witch's broom has refused to fly so Winnie casts a spell but this has now led to the spirits of the dead rising and causing chaos. The spell though did make the broom fly so Winnie must fly around the land destroying all the spirits she can. The game is viewed from the side and the screen scrolls horizontally right to left as you control Winnie. You must move around the screen trying to avoid touching the waves of spirits while shooting them. Once a wave of spirits are destroyed then a new wave appears and if you touch a spirit then you lose one of three lives.
title: Winnie Witch's Superbroom

description:
Arthur Noid needs a new challenge after getting 10 million on the arcade game Breakin so he has decided to write his own game at home. After two weeks of constant programming and coke and coffee, Arthur has finally finished the game but with lack of sleep he has finally succumbed to the Sandman. In his dreams, Arthur is Rounit Hard, Commander of the Imperial Bat, and is actually starring in his game. Arthur needs to complete 32 levels (including bonus levels) so he can wake up from his deep sleep.

The game is based on the arcade game Arkanoid and sees you controlling a bat on the bottom of the screen, bouncing a ball upwards to remove blocks above. As you remove the blocks, a barrel will appear and fall downwards and if collected will give you a power-up and these include large bat, shoot blocks, 3 balls, slow ball and an extra bat. Occasionally a Floboid moves across the screen and if hit with the ball will give you bonus points. If you let the ball go past the bat then you lose one of six lives and you have to clear all the blocks to move to the next level.
title: Arthur Noid

description: Apollo 16 has crashed and scattered into 16 pieces on the moon and it is your mission to retrieve all the pieces in the right order to rebuild it. Once you have succeeded to rebuild Apollo 16, you must collect Satellites over the surface so you can return home to Earth. The first part of the game is a platform game with the screen scrolling left or right when you move to collect the pieces and you can move up to the higher platforms using your Jet-Pack. As you search, you will encounter many aliens and these need avoiding or shooting with your laser because if you touch one then you lose one of three lives. All movements also decrease your energy which is shown by a gauge at the bottom of the screen. The second part of the game has you viewing your Shuttle from the side and you must control an arm to collect the Satellites.

sample_screenshots.caption: More parts and lots of aliens

title: Apollo Rescue

description: Alien Attack is based on the arcade game Galaxian where you move a spacecraft left or right at the bottom of the screen, blasting aliens in formation above. You must avoid the bombs that they drop as well as avoid any aliens that swoop downwards or you lose one of three lives if you touch an alien or its bombs. Once you clear the screen, you face another wave of aliens.
title: Alien Attack

description: Your mission is to move around a single screen in a craft blasting all the Baby Berks over 16 levels. Most of the Berks are in an egg and you have to wait for them to hatch before you can blast them. Using your weapon though loses you energy shown by a gauge on the bottom of the screen. Big Berks move around as well but these can't be killed, just stunned. If you touch a Baby Berk, Big Berk, egg or run out of energy then you lose one of five lives. There are five skill levels to choose from and they are Duffer, Novice, Normal, Expert and Master.
title: Baby Berks

description: Your mission in this side view horizontal scrolling shooter is to find and destroy an aircraft carrier somewhere out at sea over the course of a few days. The screen scrolls left or right constantly in the direction you are travelling. You must fly over the sea and survive every day and night until it is found while avoiding and shooting enemy planes. At the top of the screen is a radar which shows you the position of the enemy planes and as you fight the day slowly turns to night and back again. Flying decreases a fuel gauge slowly but once night turns back to day you have a chance to re-fuel with another plane by flying behind it. If you are shot by a plane or touch one, then you lose one of seven shields and if they run out or your fuel then it is game over.
title: Bandits at Zero

description: While on routine patrol over the planet Nuljai you spot the huge construction of a ring around the planet by the evil Cyfrots to syphon the water and transport it to their home planet. You decide that you will fly over the length of the ring and destroy the Pulse Mines and their marauding bombs. Battlestar is based on the game Uridium where you view your craft from above and you scroll horizontally left or right constantly in the direction you travel. As you blast the mines you must also avoid the encasements sticking up as well as bombs moving across the screen. Hitting an object loses you some shields but the faster you travel the less shields you will lose. Once you lose five shields then you lose one of five lives.
title: Battlestar

description: Your mission is to clear 32 single screens by destroying a set amount of Berks to move to the next one. As you move around the screen blasting Berks in your Terror Tank you must avoid Drones which cannot be destroyed but can be stunned. Firing your weapon though loses you energy shown by a gauge on the bottom of the screen and if you lose your energy, or touch a Berk or Drone then you lose one of five lives. There are five skill levels to choose from and these are Duffer, Novice, Normal, Expert or Master.
title: Berks

description: After all the Berks were destroyed in Berks, the creator Major Blink has decided to become a painter to make a living. You control Major Blink over various single screens full of different size blocks and paint them. To paint a block you have to paint all the sides which will complete the whole block but there are Teddies moving around the screen removing your work. Also moving around are Drones, sent by your previous employers who weren't happy at your failure but you do have a double laser to help. The Teddies can be destroyed but the Drones can only be stunned and if you touch the Teddies or Drones then you lose one of five lives. If you stand at the top of the screen in the red zone, no more Teddies will appear and once all the blocks are painted then you move to the next screen. There are five skill levels to choose from and they are Duffer, Novice, Normal, Expert and Master.

sample_screenshots.caption: Stop the bear from removing your work

title: Major Blink: Berks 2

description: The reason the Berks became angry and attacked before being destroyed was because someone infiltrated their city and stole their treasure, the source of their powers. You take control of the person responsible as you move around the flick-screen maze in your Terror Tank collecting keys to get deeper into the city. Your first task is to collect 21 keys to enter the Inner Sanctum, then collect four keys to enter the Heart of the Inner Sanctum, before you have to collect ten keys to enter the Sacred Treasure Chamber. The keys are protected by protective blocks and these need blasting to remove them. As you explore the city you will encounter Berks and Drones, the Berks can be destroyed with your laser but the Drones can only be stunned. If you touch a Berk, Drone or a protective block then you lose one of five lives. There are five skill levels to choose from and they are Duffer, Novice, Normal, Expert and Master.
title: Berks 3: They're Angry!

description:
The Berks Trilogy is a collection of three games containing games from the Berks universe by Jon Williams and they are:

  • Berks
  • Major Blink
  • Berks 3
title: The Berks Trilogy

description: The ultimate test for any Space-Cadet of the Fleet is to fly through the Blaze Zone in the Andromeda System. The zone is packed full of defences and aliens that need shooting to hopefully emerge on the other side. The game is a shooter where you move a spacecraft on the bottom of the single screen left or right, and the aim is to shoot the various items and aliens that appear on the screen. You have to shoot everything on the screen to move to the next one. If you touch anything then you lose one of five lives.
title: Blaze

description: After your success in Legionnaire, your new mission is now to secure a Bridgehead before making your way to the Enemy Headquarters over various levels. Inspired by the arcade game Green Beret, your marine is viewed from the side and you run along to the right killing as many of the enemies with your knife as you can. There are occasional platforms that appear which can be climbed by ladders and mines can appear on the floor blocking your route. The mines can be removed by throwing a limited amount of grenades but more can be collected on the way. Once you reach the end of a level you have to kill a certain amount of soldiers to move to the next level.
title: Bridgehead

description: The aim of Canoe Slalom is to paddle down an isometric scrolling river and go between gates either forwards (blue) or backwards (yellow) for as long as possible. If you miss any gate or go through one the wrong way, then you you lose one of five gate lives. As you paddle you will also encounter hazards like rocks and logs and if you touch any of these or touch the river banks then you lose one of three lives.
title: Canoe Slalom

description: You are Baron Von Helsing on holiday in Transylvania with your wife, but after one night at an Inn your wife has disappeared. You soon realise that it could be something to do with the castle on the hill even though the locals won't talk about it. You must explore the village equipping yourself, especially getting some Holy water and going to the castle to find your wife. The screen has text describing each location you are in and you type in commands with the keyboard to interact with your surroundings.
title: Castle Dracula: Adventure 5

description: Cave Fighter is a flick screen platform game where you have to escape eight levels before a timer runs out. You can walk left or right but to jump you have to hold the fire button down and the longer you hold it the higher and further you will jump. Careful use of this is needed as you can only land on the ground or the top of a platform, if you touch the sides of a platform, wall or touch an obstacle like water or spikes then you lose one of nine lives. As you get deeper into a cave you will encounter various creatures but you have a gun that fires in four directions and will send a creature back to it's original starting position when shot. If you touch a creature then you lose a life as well. Ropes can be used to climb and to get across gaps between platforms. Before you start a game you can select whether to start on the last level you were on or start from level one.
title: Cave Fighter

description: Chipy is based on the game Tetris where various coloured shapes called stones fall down the screen and the player has to move them left or right to place them below. If a full line fills the playing area across then that line disappears but if a gap remains in the line as the shapes land on top then the line stays. As well as moving the stones left or right, the player can also make the stone land below instantly, and turn the stone round. Once the stones reach the top of the playing area then it is game over.
title: Chipy

description: Your mission in this side view horizontal scrolling shooter is to blast as many waves of enemy aircraft as you can for 90 seconds to move on to the next wave. As you scroll constantly from left to right, the enemy will appear from the right and you must avoid or shoot them. A clock also counts down and every time you shoot the enemy then it resets but if you let it run down then you lose one of four lives. Touching the enemy aircraft or getting hit by their weapons also loses a life. At regular intervals, a helicopter flies below and if you bomb it then your weapon is upgraded but you only have three bombs.
title: Chopper War

description: Corman is a cat-burglar attempting to pull of the biggest diamond heist in history, with the aid of his super-power, jumping long distances. In this single screen platform game, you control Corman as you try to collect all the diamonds on each of the ten screens. Connecting the platforms are ladders, and lifts that move in one direction, and some of the platforms make Corman move. Blocks and creatures fly across the screen and if Corman touches one or falls off the bottom of the screen then he loses one of his nine lives. Before the start of the game you can select a level and the speed of the game (1-5) with one being the fastest.
title: Corman

description:
Battle is a strategy war game set in the icy waters of the North Sea and has two oil drilling companies fighting over the last remaining deposits of oil. Played against another player or the computer, each player has to destroy the other players ships, aircrafts and oil rigs by moving their ships and aircraft around a top view single screen. Each player is equipped with four ships, two submarines, a helicopter and plane to defend four oil rigs and attempt to destroy the other players crafts.

The game is split into two phases, Input Phase and Action Phase with each player taking it in turns to input their commands. Each player cycles through their various icons depicting their crafts and the player can move them around the screen, dive and surface (submarines), land and take-off (aircraft) and fire their various weapons. If a craft hits an oil rig then both are destroyed. Once both players have given their commands then the Action Phase consists of a small pause before the screen shows all the new positions.
title: Battle

description:
After 112 years of design and building by The Galactic Patrol, a prototype of the fighter/reconnaissance ship XT/99 has been completed. After extensive testing with computer simulations, the ship is passing all the tests but to really know it's capabilities it has to be flown for real in a combat zone. You have been chosen to take the ship for a test flight by flying into the combat zone and trying to get it out in one piece.

Danger Zone is a side view shooter where you control the ship on the left of the screen, moving it up or down, while various spacecraft and small asteroids fly across the screen from right to left. You must blast or avoid the crafts but the asteroids cannot be destroyed and if you are hit by a craft or asteroid then you lose part of your shield and when it is gone then you lose one of three lives. As you use your lasers then your energy will drain and when this is empty you lose a life but when you don't fire then it will increase.
title: Danger Zone

description: Earth is once again under attack from alien invaders and you have been tasked to fly your spacecraft over the planet's surface and destroy their Landers and Pods over various levels. The game is a side view horizontal scrolling shooter and you move your craft up or down and you can scroll both left to right, or right to left. On the surface are Landers and these will attempt to fly up into the air to escape so you must blast them and when a certain amount have been destroyed you move to the next level. To defend the Landers are Pods which fly in the air and these need blasting as well with their weapons needing to be avoided. If you touch a Lander, Pod, its weapon or the surface then you lose one of three lives. Two players can play and each player takes it in turn to play when the other player is killed.
title: Defence-16

description: A nasty old wizard has kidnapped your girl and is holding her in the grounds of his castle and in this single screen platform game, you Dirty Den must go and rescue her over various screens. To clear each screen you must reach a love heart while collecting all the chocolate to move to the next screen. On each screen are various creatures with some firing bullets at you and you must kill them all with your bullets to progress. Touching any creature loses you one of five lives and clearing a screen gives you an extra one. As well as the normal platforms, there are moving platforms as well as poles that take you upwards.
title: Dirty Den

description: You are Dork and you have crashed your spaceship and knocked yourself out on an unknown planet. Waking up, you realise that the planets occupants, Zobwats have stripped your spaceship clean and hidden the parts in an underground kingdom. Each piece is placed in the middle of various single screens with exits on the walls and you must kill a certain amount of Zobwats to get each piece. To kill the Zobwats you must drop a Time Bomb and it will explode after a couple of seconds so you need to make sure you are not in its blast range. After the bomb explodes it takes a few seconds for you to be able to use another one. If you are hit by the blast range or hit a Zobwat then you lose one of three lives. Once all Zobwats are destroyed then the piece appears on the right of the screen in a jigsaw grid and you move to an exit to find another piece of your ship using a map on the right side of the screen. At any time you can go to the jigsaw grid to rearrange the pieces in their correct place.
title: Dork's Dilemma?

description:
You have defeated aliens in the Diagon Zone and kept the spaceways free in a Solo fighter, and now in your new mission you are searching for Di-Planium Ore. You have gone to various zones on Vragus IV to look for the ore but have discovered humans trapped and they must be rescued.

Inspired by the arcade game Robotron: 2084, Droid One is a single screen shooter over 32 screens where you have to shoot and avoid various creatures to collect humans. If you are touched by a creature then you lose of of three lives and as well as your weapon you also have three smart bombs which destroys all on the screen. As well as the normal game there is a suicide mission where you have to last for one minute in each zone.
title: Droid One

description: After defending the Diagon Zone, the aliens are now trying to intercept a delivery of Di-Planium carried by yourself in a SOLO fighter. You sit on the bottom of the screen and various waves of alien ships move around the screen trying to hit you with their weapons. You can move around the screen but you can only fire forwards. If you touch an alien or its weapons then you lose one of five lives.
title: Solo

description: The secret of Zor is deep in a castle belonging to Endag and it is your mission to enter the castle to find the core of the Crypt Cabal and the secret of Zor. Enigma is a flick screen maze game viewed from above and you must search the passageways finding nine keys to pass through doors. The keys and doors are numbered so the keys must be matched with the correct door to proceed. As you explore the depths of the castle you will encounter various creatures out to stop you and if you touch one then you lose one of three lives. To protect yourself, you are armed with a laser but the use of this is limited shown by an energy gauge at the bottom of the screen and extra energy for your laser can be found scattered around the maze. Before you start the game you can select the level of difficulty (1-4)

sample_screenshots.caption: Lets get the secret of Zor

title: Enigma

description: As a newly qualified graduate of the Space Geology College, things are looking good for G Man as he explores the Sea of Dreams on the Moon. Looking for samples and using a jet-pac, G Man is having so much fun he forgot the timings of the Moonbus back to Earth. It has left his location and landed 4 Km away and will take-off again in seven minutes back to Earth. In this side view left to right constantly scrolling game, you control G Man as you try to fly and run on the surface of the moon back to the Moonbus. As well as the dangers on the surface like gaps to clear, there are also meteors flying in the sky from right to left. You must use your jet-pac to avoid the gaps and the meteors being aware of the momentum when moving and gravity pulling you downwards. You can speed up when flying but any use of the jet-pac uses fuel but there are fuel dumps which can be collected.
title: 'g'man

description: Once a prosperous place to live, your town has been turned into a Ghost Town by the evil wizard Belegro with a spell. After he cast the spell, he took all the treasure and hid them in one room. Your quest is to search the town in this top view flick-screen arcade adventure using the items found and using them on other screens. There are secret items and many obstacles and dangers and if any are touched, then this loses your life and the game has to be started again.

sample_screenshots.caption: How to get the pliers in that bush?

title: Ghost Town

description: Your planet is being raided by Space Pirates and you have been tasked to meet them on the Desert of Pillars and destroy them all in your Gullwing Falcon over various levels. The game is a 3rd person shooter with you sat behind the Falcon, with Pillars and pirates coming towards you. You are able to control the speed of your craft and you must either fly between the Pillars for bonus points or avoid them. To clear a level you must shoot a certain amount of Pirates before a timer runs out and the number increases for every level. If you touch the Pillars, Pirates or run out of time then you lose one of four lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Avoid or fly through the pillars

title: Gullwing Falcon

description: Bearing only a superficial likeness to the Dragon 32 version, Cuthbert in the Cooler for the Commodore 16 has none of the prison camp theme, instead being a totally independent development that Microdeal saw as sufficiently similar to put the same label on. Gone are the barracks and the prison guards, and instead you run around picking up apples, keys and other items, while laying bombs in labyrinths guarded by skulls, mummies and fires, resulting in a game that is a bit of Oh Mummy and a bit of Mr. Do, while being so simplified that it doesn't equal either.

sample_screenshots.caption: All bonuses picked up, you can go on to the next level

title: Cuthbert in the Cooler

description: You are Special Agent Louis Mooney aka Leapin' Louie and you have been captured by the Grong Empire and you plan to escape. In this single screen platform game, you must move through ten rooms avoiding the robot guards and traps to get to freedom. To escape from a room you have to reach a teleporter but this requires six batteries to operate and the batteries are scattered around each screen. The batteries must be collected and the teleporter reached before a power gauge empties. As well as robot guards to avoid there are platforms that disappear when walked on and objects that cannot be touched. If you hit a robot or object, or your power runs out then you lose one of three lives.
title: Leapin' Louie!

description:
Inspired by the arcade game Q*Bert, you take the role of Pancho who has to paint all the squares on various heights in a isometric view on a single screen. To paint a square, all Pancho has to do is land on a square but needs to avoid a Mad Mexican Muncher that moves around the screen and if he touches it then he loses one of three lives. Also moving around the screen is a wild jumping bean that changes the squares back to their original colour but this can be caught to remove it.

Pancho starts a level on one of two magic carpets and these can be stood on to have a breather as the Muncher can't land on them. Pressing the fire button anywhere on the screen transports Pancho on to one but this can only be done four times. Once the level has been cleared then it's onto the next one but with more Munchers and the squares have to be landed on more than once to paint them.
title: Pancho

description: Searching the Valley of the Kings, you have come across some hieroglyphics telling you of a power which can be unlocked by a key in a pyramid. The power sits dormant in the sacred Triangle of the Gods left by an evil wizard. The key though has been broken into four pieces and scattered around the tombs of the pyramid and you have decided to search for the pieces to open the Triangle. Pharaoh's Tomb is an flick screen arcade adventure with each screen viewed from an elevated angle. You must search the tombs looking for the pieces of the key as well as treasures and other useful objects. In certain rooms are mummies and giant spiders and when one is touched then it is game over.
title: Pharaoh's Tomb

description: In this sequel to the Boulder Dash clone, Rockman, you once again try to get all the diamonds in ten multi-directional scrolling caverns. Each level as well as the diamonds have a number of hazards which need to be avoided and they are boulders, bows, holes and radioactive waste. The main hazard are the boulders and when you walk underneath clearing the dirt they will fall if a gap appears and any stacked on top will fall downwards where there is no dirt and will kill you if they fall on you. Bows cannot be touched, holes move randomly and are fatal to the touch and radioactive waste spreads where there is no dirt and although not fatal can dissolve boulders causing others to fall. If you get hit by a boulder, touch a bow or a hole then you lose one of four lives.
title: The Return of Rockman

description: Roller Kong is a single screen platform game based on the arcade game Donkey Kong where you have to rescue a maiden at the top of the screen. Holding her hostage is a giant ape and you have to get from the bottom of the screen climbing ladders to rescue her before a spider moves from the right of the screen and gets her. To stop you the ape will throw barrels which move along the platforms and down the ladders as well as fireballs which move diagonally across the screen. If you touch a barrel or a fireball then you lose one of three lives but the barrels can be stopped when you collect an axe for a short time but you can't climb ladders. Flowers can also be collected along the way for extra points. Once you rescue the maiden then you move on to the next level which has elevators replacing ladders and now the ape throws monsters called Spinks but there is no spider.
title: Roller Kong

description:
Summer Events is a Olympic multi-event game where up to four players can compete in seven separate events. After the opening ceremony the players enter their names and pick a country listening to the national anthem. The players are presented with various options and they include, play all events, compete in some events, and practise the events. The seven events are:

Butterfly Swimming: The screen is split into two parts showing two swimmers viewed from the side with the screen scrolling. The swimmers have to swim the butterfly stroke for two lengths of the pool as fast as possible.

Pole Vault: Viewed from the side on a single screen, each player has to first choose a height before having three attempts to clear the bar at the selected height.

Javelin: The thrower is viewed from the side and the screen scrolls as the player runs towards a line and has to throw the javelin as far as possible.

Skeet Shooting: A single screen viewed from a 1st person perspective has each player having to shoot as many skeets from various positions. The player has five rounds and has to reload when the gun is empty.

Platform Diving: A single screen viewed from the side, each diver has four diving options to select from before attempting to complete as many somersaults as they can and entering the water cleanly.

Cycling: The screen is split into two parts showing two cyclists viewed from the side with the screen scrolling. The cyclists have to ride their bike along a straight course from left to right as fast as possible.

Weight Lifting: A single screen which sees a lifter facing the player and has to lift weights in two disciplines, Snatch and Clean and Jerk. After choosing the weight the lifter has to lift the weights above their heads and hold it there for a short time.
title: Summer Events

description: You have been sent to the planet Terra Nova to search for much needed minerals for your home planet. Long range scanners report that the planet is uninhabited but when you approach the planet your short range scanners confirm that there is life and the planet is heavily defended. In this top view vertically scrolling shooter, you must fly over four sectors to get the minerals needed blasting and avoiding aliens and defences. As you fly over the sectors you have limited fuel and ammo which decrease the further you fly but there are various dumps that increase them. To complete a sector you must fly over it three times docking with your Mothership each time which also refuels and rearms your craft. If you touch an alien or defence, or are shot then you lose one of five lives.
title: Terra Nova

description: You are Indiana Bloggs and in this scrolling platform game you are exploring the Tomb of Tarrabash over four levels for the treasures that lie deep within. As you explore, you will encounter many creatures and traps and if you touch any then you lose one of three lives. You are armed with a gun and this can be used to shoot the creatures and the traps encountered include spikes and moving walls. Once you complete a level you receive an extra life and you can start on that level when you lose all your lives.
title: Tomb of Tarrabash

description: Your planet is under attack by Trizon forces and you are the last of a huge fleet to protect your planet by blasting as many of the invaders in your craft over various levels. The game is a horizontal scrolling shooter viewed from an elevated angle and you must blast as many aliens coming from the right of the screen before an energy gauge runs out. Next to your energy gauge is a Triz Force gauge and to complete a level you must blast the aliens to fill it to the right, if any alien goes past you then the gauge moves to the left. If you touch an alien, it's bullets or allow too many aliens to pass you then you lose one of five lives.
title: Trizons

description:
Bounder and Planet Search is a collection of two games that only appeared on compilations for the Commodore 16 and the games were:

Bounder: In this top view vertical scrolling platform game, you control a tennis ball that bounces up and down, and you must get from one end of a level to the other end over various levels. Each level is high in the air and you must keep the ball on solid platforms while avoiding the obstacles, gaps and aliens and if you touch an alien or obstacle, or fall off the platforms then you lose one of six lives. Certain platforms give you bonuses, let you bounce further or teleport you to new parts of the level. At the end of a level you play a bonus stage where you have to land on as many question marks as you can.

Planet Search: You are lost in a distant Galaxy and the only way home is to fly over the surface of eight planets to finally reach your goal. In this side view scrolling shooter you must blast a certain amount of aliens on each planet that appears. Above the playing area is a scanner showing the positions of the aliens and you can fly either to the right or the left to find and blast them. Each destroyed alien leaves behind an egg and this must be collected before it hatches into another alien. If you touch an alien then you lose part of a shield, take too many hits and your scanner stops working before you lose one of three lives. Once you have completed a level you must fly through a side view tunnel to get to the next planet and if you touch the sides then you are sent back to the last planet.

sample_screenshots.caption: Planet Search: Off to the next planet

title: Bounder and Planet Search

description:
C16's plus4 Classics is a collection of four games that contains the following games:

  • Dork's Dilemma
  • Tycoon Tex
  • Xargon Wars
  • Petals of Doom
title: C16's plus4 Classics

description:
C16's plus4 Classics II is a collection of four games that contains the following games:

  • Monkey Magic
  • Blagger
  • Timeslip
  • Xargon's Revenge
title: C16's plus4 Classics II

description:
Cartridge Triple Pack is a collection of three text adventures that contains the following games:

  • Strange Odyssey
  • Atomic Mission
  • Pirate Adventure
title: Cartridge Triple Pack

description:
Commodore 16 Games Pack I is a collection of 15 unreleased games that contains the following games:

Micro Minotaur: You must move around a 10 x 10 grid full of numbers and question marks and you have to guess a number between 0 and 99. As you move a minotaur moves around the grid trying to catch you. Landing on a number is then added to your score while question marks gives you a clue.

Breakin: A Breakout clone where you have to hit a ball upwards with a bat, removing the bricks. If the ball goes past the bat and hits the border then you lose one of nine lives. Before the start of a game you can select the game number (1-3) or the size of the bat (2-3).

Warlock: A text adventure where you have to move a round a Warlock's cave to survive as long as possible while getting as much treasure as you can. You will encounter monsters that can be fought, use a spell or retreat from. You have a strength of 98 and when it reaches zero it is game over.

Unscramble!: You have a 4 x 4 grid filled with 15 squares numbered 1 to 15 and a blank square in a mixed sequence. You must move the squares using the blank square to put the squares in the correct sequence with square 1 in the top left.

Blockade: A two player game where you move a cursor around the screen leaving behind a trail and you have to get your opponent to crash his cursor into your trail.

Hangman: Based on the pen and paper game, you are given a word that you have to guess by typing in the letters you think make up the word. A correct guess makes the letter appear in the word, but a wrong guess makes part of a man getting hanged appear. You win when you guess the word but lose when the whole hanged man picture appears.

Dragon's Lair: A text adventure where you move around the Dragon's Lair looking for treasure while avoiding the roaming Dragon. You will encounter monsters which can be fought or a spell used. You have a strength of 15 and it is game over if you lose all your strength.

Blackjack: A version of the casino card game where you have to beat the dealer by getting a total of 21 or as close to with out going over. Once you have received your score the dealer then plays trying to beat your hand.

Penetrator: In your ship you must move up and down the side of the screen blasting aliens that appear in three mountains to your right. Once there are five or less aliens then you can pick up and rescue a spaceman at the bottom of the screen. There are nine levels of play to choose from (1-9) with one being the hardest.

S.A.M.: An enemy craft flies around the screen and you must fire a missile from you launcher at the bottom of the screen and control its flight to try to hit the enemy.

Seige: Two ballista's sit either side of the screen in front of a castle and you must fire rocks at the other castle trying to destroy it before your castle is destroyed.

2D Maze: You are in a 1st person perspective maze and you must move around the maze to find the exit.

Zapp: Missiles fall from the sky leaving a trail and you must control a cross hair to blast the missiles before they land and destroy cities at the bottom of the screen.

Star Trader: You are the pilot of a merchant vessel and in this text game you must move around deep space buying and selling goods to make enough money to pay off your bank loan with the Solar Interstellar Bank.

Looney Landa: Inspired by Lunar Lander, you have to land a falling spacecraft on a landing pad using your thrusters to combat gravity.
title: Commodore 16 Games Pack I

description:
Players take on the role of Tycoon Tex, an oil tycoon and with the task is to protect the pipeline by patrolling it and fixing any gaps and shooting bombs that are dropped by jet fighters over various levels.

The game is a side view horizontal scroller and the player must run along the pipeline at a controlled speed by going faster or slower. To complete the level, the player must fill a % complete gauge before the oil pressure gauge reaches zero by jumping over any gaps in the pipeline to fix them. The faster the player runs, the quicker the pressure gauge decreases. Bombs dropped from the jets make gaps, however they can be shot; if the player misses, the gap may be jumped to fix it.

If the player hits a gap or a bomb, the player will lose a life. Before the game starts, the player may select how many lives to have (1-6). There are also three difficulty levels to choose from: easy, hard, and impossible.
title: Tycoon Tex

description: Cyborg is a single screen shooter where you must blast all the aliens that appear on the screen to clear the level over an infinite amount of levels. You can only move in four directions and if you are touched by an alien then you lose one of five lives. You are also armed with three smart bombs which help to rid the screen of aliens.
title: Cyborg

description: Space Shuttle Columbia has taken off and entered Earth's orbit to deliver six Uranium fuel packs to the rocket Argon but the orbit of Argon is too high. Your mission, in this side view single screen game is to leave Columbia in your space suit and fly upwards to deliver the Uranium one by one. Starting at the bottom of the screen you collect a pack of Uranium and fly upwards to the top of the screen avoiding asteroids, debris and satellites. Once you reach the top of the screen, you place the Uranium in one of six bays before flying downwards to pick up another pack of Uranium. You keep repeating the process being careful not to place a pack into a bay already with a pack of Uranium. Once the delivery is made you then move to another screen to repeat the same delivery but harder. If you touch any object or place the Uranium in a full bay then you lose one of three lives and start all over again.
title: Lunar Docking

description:
Olympiad is a multi-sport event game based on eight track and field events, all viewed from the side where waggling the joystick left to right or pressing two keys as fast as you can is the name of the game. The track events are 100m, 200m, 400m and 800m, the field events are Javelin, Long Jump, Shot-Put and Hammer. Before each event starts you are shown the World Record and you select whether you are male or female.

The field events allows you to see the computers distance before you input an angle between 20 and 60 degrees. You waggle/press as fast as you can watching a gauge increase before it changes colour, the computer is now controlling your speed. When you reach a line or are standing in the correct position you press fire and the object is thrown or you jump. After you receive your distance or fail in your attempt you can then chose another event.

The track events has you competing against the computer where you just waggle/press as fast as you can for the selected distance in an attempt to win. After your race you can then choose another event.
title: Olympiad

description:
Commodore 16 Games pack II is a collection of 15 unreleased games that contains the following games:

Minotaur: You start at the bottom centre of a 38 x 15 grid full of numbers and X's and you have to guess a number between 0 to 1000 while avoiding the Minotaur. Moving around the grid, every number collected gets added to your score with the X's giving you clues. Once you go over the number then the minotaur starts to chase you. If you think you know the number then you move to a white block.

Hunter: The screen has a grid of squares 15 x 10 with paths inbetween. You must move along the paths collecting dots while avoiding a hunter.

Letterbox: You are a mailman at the bottom of the screen and you must catch letters that fall from the top of the screen. When a letter falls then you press that letter to move towards it to catch it. If you catch it you place the letter in the tower on the left of the screen. Miss the letter and it appears in the right side tower.

Ganymede: In this space management game, you must run a small moon base on one of Jupiter's moon, Ganymede while mining for ore. You must build ships and mines while mining and selling the ore to Earth. Oxygen levels must be watched and purchased when low.

Dumper: Your City is protected by a huge shield which an alien invader is trying to destroy by dropping bombs on it. You must move a vehicle left or right on top of the shield, rebuilding the gaps made by the alien.

Alien Overrun: Your spacecraft has been invaded by aliens and are multiplying and you must move around the craft avoiding the aliens while standing on green squares to wipe them out.

Dungeon: Armed with a sword you must move around a flick-screen dungeon for as long as possible. You have three attributes Fatigue, Wounds and Weight and you must avoid or fight monsters you encounter.

Chess: Based on the strategy board game of the same name, you must move various pieces around a 8 x 8 board taking your opponents pieces to trap his King.

Scrambler: You are flying over a mountain range trying not to crash into it. The lower you fly the more points you receive but fly too high and your score decreases. Meteors have to be avoided as well.

Crash Barrier: You must drive around a track for as long as possible while avoiding touching the walls as well as avoiding gates that appear randomly for a few seconds.

Snake Pit: A one or two player game where you move a letter that leaves behind a trail and you must get your opponent to crash into your trail while avoiding his.

Reel thing!: You play on a fruit machine with $10 in your pocket and you must keep spinning the four reels to make different combinations to win more money. The aim is to make $2000.

Mind Quiz: Based on the board game Mastermind, the computer or another player thinks of four colours in a specific order. You must keep guessing the combination and if any colours are correct in the correct order then you are shown a black circle, guess the correct colour but in the wrong order then you are shown a white circle.

Tank Ambush: You control a tank in a forest and you must avoid or shoot heat-seeking missiles for as long as possible.

Road Patrol: You control a vehicle on the bottom of the screen, moving it left or right to shoot aliens that appear above with your missiles while avoiding bombs dropped from the aliens.
title: Commodore 16 Games pack II

description:
Matrix and Laserzone is a double games pack containing the following two C16 conversions of Jeff Minter games:

  • Matrix
  • Laserzone
title: Matrix and Laserzone

description:
The Commodore Plus/4 Adventure Pack is a collection of four text adventures unreleased on the C16 by Peter Gerrard. Each adventure has text on the screen describing each location you visit and you type in commands with the keyboard to interact with your surroundings. The collection contains:

Colossal Cave: Based on the first adventure written on a mainframe computer, you have to explore a cave while attempting to outwit a Troll, Dragon and a Pirate. You must avoid traps and solve puzzles.

True Spit: Set in the Wild West where you take to role of a Bounty Hunter looking to make your fortune. You arrive in the town of Ducksville looking for anyone with a price on their head.

Spaced Out: You are in a bar full of space heroes and you have to protect a secret formula as you attempt to leave the bar in 50 moves before carrying on with your adventure.

Underground Adventure: On a dusty beaten track one afternoon you have decided to explore some caves in the hills. Many people have entered but have never left and you must explore them to find out their dark secrets.
title: The Commodore Plus/4 Adventure Pack

description:
Stellar Wars & Blitz is a double games pack that contains two games previously only released for the Commodore 64:

Stellar Wars: A 1st person shooter where you must control a cross-hair and shoot as many Stellar Fighters as you can within 100 seconds. As you blast you musn't let the fighters get too close or you lose the ability to fire your lasers for a few seconds and constant use of your lasers makes them overheat and once again you are unable to fire. There are nine skill levels to choose from (1-9).

Blitz: Flying your plane, you have run out of fuel and are slowly gliding towards the ground but unfortunately there is a sprawling City below which needs bombing. Viewed from the side on a single screen, your plane moves across the screen from left to right and when it reaches the side of the screen it appears on the left one place lower. You can only drop one bomb at a time and if you hit a building then it is game over.
title: Stellar Wars & Blitz

description: Cruncher is a Pac-Man clone where you must move around a top view single screen maze eating all the dots to clear the level. As you eat the dots, four Ghosts will chase you and if you touch one then you lose one of three lives.
